summary: Fix hero section layout shift by setting appropriate container heights to accommodate the longest typing animation phrase across all screen sizes, preventing cumulative layout shift (CLS) during text transitions.

action_plan.description: Calculate optimal min-height values for hero-title container by testing the longest phrase 'Machine Learning Researcher' across different screen sizes and font sizes to determine maximum height needed
Update desktop hero-title CSS to increase min-height from current 6rem to accommodate longest phrase without wrapping, likely 7-8rem based on current clamp font sizing
Update mobile hero-title CSS (within @media query) to increase min-height from current 4rem to accommodate longest phrase on smaller screens, likely 5-6rem
Add line-height consistency and ensure proper vertical alignment within the fixed-height container to maintain visual balance
Test the typing animation across different viewport sizes to verify no layout shifts occur during phrase transitions and adjust heights if needed
Verify that the fixed heights don't negatively impact the overall hero section layout and spacing with other elements

risks: Fixed height might create too much whitespace for shorter phrases, affecting visual balance
Different browsers or devices might render text differently, requiring additional height adjustments
Changes might affect the overall hero section proportions and visual hierarchy
dependencies: Need to test across multiple screen sizes and devices to determine optimal heights
Should verify font loading is complete before measuring to ensure consistent rendering
